intro: Acinos grandiflorus, commonly known as the grandiflorous pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Acinos grandiflorus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes, where it thrives in full sun.
